Class CcddImportSupportHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • CCDD.CcddImportSupportHandler
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CcddCSVHandler, CcddEDSHandler, CcddJSONHandler, CcddXTCEHandler

    public class CcddImportSupportHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    CFS Command and Data Dictionary import support handler class

    • Method Detail

      • addImportedTableTypeColumnDefinition

        protected boolean addImportedTableTypeColumnDefinition(boolean continueOnError,
                                                       CcddClassesDataTable.TableTypeDefinition tableTypeDefn,
                                                       java.lang.String[] columnDefn,
                                                       java.lang.String fileName,
                                                       CcddInputTypeHandler inputTypeHandler,
                                                       java.awt.Component parent)
                                                throws CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException
        Add a table type column definition after verifying the input parameters
        Parameters:
        continueOnError - current state of the flag that indicates if all table type errors should be ignored
        tableTypeDefn - reference to the TableTypeDefinition to which this column definition applies
        columnDefn - array containing the table type column definition
        fileName - import file name
        inputTypeHandler - input type handler reference
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Returns:
        true if the user elected to ignore the column error
        Throws:
        CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException - If the column name is missing or the user elects to stop the import operation due to an invalid input type

      • addImportedDataFieldDefinition

        protected boolean addImportedDataFieldDefinition(boolean continueOnError,
                                                 java.lang.Object defnContainer,
                                                 java.lang.String[] fieldDefn,
                                                 java.lang.String fileName,
                                                 CcddInputTypeHandler inputTypeHandler,
                                                 CcddFieldHandler fieldHandler,
                                                 java.awt.Component parent)
                                          throws CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException
        Add a data field definition after verifying the input parameters are valid (use defaults for field size, input type, or applicability if these parameters that are not supplied). For project-level or table type fields, if the field already exists for this owner compare the field definition's input type, required status, applicability, and value; if a mismatch is found allow the user to determine how to proceed (this check is unnecessary for table fields since the new ones either replace existing ones or are ignored, based on the import flags)
        Parameters:
        continueOnError - current state of the flag that indicates if all data field errors should be ignored
        defnContainer - TableDefinition, TableTypeDefinition, or projectDefinition object to which this data field applies
        fieldDefn - array containing the data field definition
        fileName - import file name
        inputTypeHandler - input type handler reference
        fieldHandler - data field handler reference
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Returns:
        true if the user elected to ignore the data field error
        Throws:
        CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException - If the data field name is missing or the user elects to stop the import operation due to an invalid input type

      • buildProjectAndGroupDataFields

        protected void buildProjectAndGroupDataFields(CcddFieldHandler fieldHandler,
                                              java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> dataFields)
        Build the project-level and group data fields
        Parameters:
        fieldHandler - data field handler reference
        dataFields - list containing the data field definitions from the import file

      • addImportedGroupDefinition

        protected void addImportedGroupDefinition(java.lang.String[] groupDefn,
                                          java.lang.String fileName,
                                          boolean replaceExistingGroups,
                                          CcddGroupHandler groupHandler)
                                   throws CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException
        Add a group's information from the supplied group definition after verifying the input parameters
        Parameters:
        groupDefn - array containing the group definition
        fileName - import file name
        replaceExistingGroups - true to replace existing group definitions
        groupHandler - group handler reference
        Throws:
        CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException - If the group name or member table list is missing

      • addImportedScriptAssociation

        protected boolean addImportedScriptAssociation(boolean continueOnError,
                                               java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> associations,
                                               java.lang.String[] assnDefn,
                                               java.lang.String fileName,
                                               CcddScriptHandler scriptHandler,
                                               java.awt.Component parent)
                                        throws CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException
        Add a script association after verifying the input parameters are valid (script file name is provided and the association doesn't already exist). If an association with the same name but different script file or members exists allow the user to determine how to proceed
        Parameters:
        continueOnError - current state of the flag that indicates if all script association errors should be ignored
        associations - list of the current script associations
        assnDefn - array containing the script association
        fileName - import file name
        scriptHandler - script handler reference
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Returns:
        true if the user elected to ignore the data field error
        Throws:
        CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException - If the script file name is missing, or an association with the same name but different script file or members exists and the user elects to stop the import operation

      • setProjectHeaderTablesAndVariables

        protected void setProjectHeaderTablesAndVariables(CcddFieldHandler fieldHandler,
                                                  boolean isCreateField,
                                                  java.lang.String tlmHdrTable,
                                                  java.lang.String cmdHdrTable,
                                                  java.lang.String appIDName,
                                                  java.lang.String funcCodeName)
        Set the telemetry header table name, command header table name, application ID variable name, and command function code variable name from the project database fields or default values, if not present in the import file. Based on the input flag build the project-level data fields for these names
        Parameters:
        fieldHandler - data field handler reference
        isCreateField - true is the project-level data fields are to be created
        tlmHdrTable - name of the structure table that represents the common header for all telemetry tables; null if not present in the import file
        cmdHdrTable - name of the structure table that represents the common header for all command tables; null if not present in the import file
        appIDName - telemetry and command header variable names for the application ID; null if not present in the import file
        funcCodeName - command header variable name for the command function code; null if not present in the import file

      • getErrorResponse

        protected boolean getErrorResponse(boolean continueOnError,
                                   java.lang.String message,
                                   java.lang.String title,
                                   java.lang.String ignoreToolTip,
                                   java.lang.String ignoreAllToolTip,
                                   java.lang.String cancelToolTip,
                                   java.awt.Component parent)
                            throws CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException
        Display an Ignore/Ignore All/Cancel dialog in order to get the response to an error condition. The user may elect to ignore the one instance of this type of error, all instances of this type of error, or cancel the operation
        Parameters:
        continueOnError - current state of the flag that indicates if all errors of this type should be ignored
        message - text message to display
        title - title to display in the dialog window frame
        ignoreToolTip - Ignore button tool tip text; null if no tool tip is to be displayed
        ignoreAllToolTip - Ignore All button tool tip text; null if no tool tip is to be displayed
        cancelToolTip - Cancel button tool tip text; null if no tool tip is to be displayed
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Returns:
        true if the user elected to ignore errors of this type
        Throws:
        CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException - If the user selects the Cancel button

      • getErrorResponse

        protected boolean getErrorResponse(boolean continueOnError,
                                   java.lang.String message,
                                   java.lang.String title,
                                   java.lang.String ignoreToolTip,
                                   java.lang.String ignoreAllToolTip,
                                   java.lang.String cancelToolTip,
                                   boolean noIgnore,
                                   java.awt.Component parent)
                            throws CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException
        Display an Ignore/Ignore All/Cancel or Ignore All/Cancel dialog in order to get the response to an error condition. The user may elect to ignore the one instance of this type of error, all instances of this type of error, or cancel the operation
        Parameters:
        continueOnError - current state of the flag that indicates if all errors of this type should be ignored
        message - text message to display
        title - title to display in the dialog window frame
        ignoreToolTip - Ignore button tool tip text; null if no tool tip is to be displayed
        ignoreAllToolTip - Ignore All button tool tip text; null if no tool tip is to be displayed
        cancelToolTip - Cancel button tool tip text; null if no tool tip is to be displayed
        noIgnore - true to not display the Ignore button
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Returns:
        true if the user elected to ignore errors of this type
        Throws:
        CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException - If the user selects the Cancel button

                                                      throws CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException
        Check input type definition parameters for validity
        Parameters:
        inputTypeDefn - array containing the input type definition
        Returns:
        The input type definition, with the regular expression built if the definition contains a selection item list
        Throws:

      • getBaseDataType

        protected static CcddImportSupportHandler.BasePrimitiveDataType getBaseDataType(java.lang.String dataType,
                                                                                CcddDataTypeHandler dataTypeHandler)
        Convert the primitive data type into the base equivalent
        Parameters:
        dataType - data type
        dataTypeHandler - reference to the data type handler
        Returns:
        Base primitive data type corresponding to the specified primitive data type; null if no match

      • getMatchingDataType

        protected java.lang.String getMatchingDataType(long sizeInBytes,
                                               boolean isInteger,
                                               boolean isUnsigned,
                                               boolean isFloat,
                                               boolean isString,
                                               CcddDataTypeHandler dataTypeHandler)
        Get the data type name determined by the specified data type size and match criteria
        Parameters:
        sizeInBytes - data type size in bytes
        isInteger - true if the data type to match is an integer
        isUnsigned - true if the data type to match is an unsigned integer
        isFloat - true if the data type to match is a floating point
        isString - true if the data type to match is a character or string
        dataTypeHandler - reference to the data type handler
        Returns:
        The name of the data type from the existing data type definitions that matches the input criteria; null if there is no match

      • cleanSystemPath

        protected static java.lang.String cleanSystemPath(java.lang.String path)
        Replace each invalid character with an underscore and move any leading underscores to the end of each path segment
        Parameters:
        path - system path in the form <</>path1</path2<...>>
        Returns:
        Path with each invalid character replaced with an underscore and any leading underscores moved to the end of each path segment
